caption_overlay.text: Check out this easy side hustle I do right here from the front desk.
Our gym gets super quiet mid-afternoon, and this TV just sits here. My manager was cool with me trying something to fill our off-peak classes.
I use this app, Trillboards. On my phone, I just scanned a QR code from their site to pair this screen. Super simple.
I picked a 'class fill' template, added our 2 PM yoga special, and then browsed the marketplace to add a promo for the juice bar down the street.
It just rotates automatically. We get more sign-ups, and the screen makes a little extra from the promos—maybe $10 to $40 a day. It really depends on foot traffic.
It's just a quiet, useful tool that solves a problem for us and the juice bar.

trillboards_touchpoints.action: Host scans a QR code on the TV using their phone.
trillboards_touchpoints.why_it_helps: Instantly connects the TV to the app without any hardware or complicated setup.

trillboards_touchpoints.action: Host selects a 'class fill' template and adds a card for a yoga class.
trillboards_touchpoints.why_it_helps: Quickly gets relevant, goal-oriented content on screen in seconds.

trillboards_touchpoints.action: Host adds a paid promo from the local marketplace.
trillboards_touchpoints.why_it_helps: Creates a small, passive revenue stream by utilizing screen downtime for relevant local offers.

constraints_and_risks: Must have permission from the venue owner or manager to use the screen.
Ensure any local promos shown are non-competitive and fit the gym's brand (e.g., health food, athletic wear, not another gym or fast food).

metrics_hypothesis.shareability_notes: Highly shareable among gym/studio staff, part-time workers in venues with TVs, and side-hustle enthusiasts looking for low-effort ideas.

alt_hooks: This TV used to be totally useless between classes...
My manager loves this little trick for filling our 2 PM classes.

rights_and_clearance_notes: Requires permission to film at the gym location. Any gym branding must be cleared for use. Local promo examples should use fictional or cleared brand names.
